Curious what about the allegations you have problems with and what about Linus' response you think lends him credibility.

I think the allegations that Madison is leveling are very serious. If true, LMG has a problem. I feel bad for her if that was what she went though.

I have felt mistreated in a work place, and have been on the wrong side of things.  It sucks. I can't speak to all the harassment, but I can speak to a negative work place that drains you of life.

My problem is that her timing is hella suspect. She chose now when she felt people would be on her side. I want to believe her, but past experiences of trusting someones allegations have me concerned.

She voiced that she held back what she would say in fear of this community doing what it is doing now.  Being an unreasonable mob that is out for blood and wants to tear down the establishment.

She also mentions in her story, that HR didn't always know what was going on, and they didn't know what was happening cause she didn't tell them.

Madison also mentioned that Linus said publicly he wouldn't address anything, and as long as no one says anything he is innocent hehehe....

That is projecting. It was a standard response and she read into it what she wanted too.

I think there is more to this, and I am waiting.  I think this dogpiling is crazy.  Its a pitchfork sale and people are a buying!

I hope the truth comes out.

Linus has had credibility.  LMG has responded to criticism and addressed concerns if not fully backed out of stuff.  He has offered transparency and acknowledged when they can improve.  This community has forgotten how much he has helped create a nerd tech space, and bolstered other creators.

How this has been relegated and forgotten about is so disingenuous.

I have to agree,
LMG had little to no fault in this, the rushed videos? Linus rushed everyone.
Inaccuracies? Probably main reason is Linus rushing them. Accidentally auctioning off a prototype, that's quite unfortunate. In the light of the whole story none of them a dealbreaker.

Linus on the other hand with going solo responding in a forum post, now that was an asshole thing to do, he made everything a thousand times worse. I am truly angry he did not even take into care that there is a team behind him, he is responsible for.
But they seemed genuinenly happy, relieved and excited about the new chapter in LMG's life (except for Linus)

As for Madison, I will have to wait for investigations to conclude, it's easy to jump the gun and blame linus since he was an asshole in the past few days, but that doesn't necessarily means there wasn't any misunderstanding, or miss communication.

I see it can be hard for people to stay objective. Whether Madison was right, or there were other factors even she wasn't avare.

What I am worried about that stirring up the whole thing and not letting LMG and Madison handle this privately...  old wounds are gonna be torn up, and that is what you really don't want in her case, mental health is no joke.
PREACH BROTHER!
Rushing an apology video for rushing videos seems, at best, incredibly stupid.

That is a different topic, but I personally can understand, things started to spiral out of control real fast, like in a matter of hours.

Situation escalated and they had to respond, they couldn't just sit around for days planning, they had to act fast, before the situation gets out of hand, mistakes happened sure, like the price going public, that was truly a bad place bad time to happen to them, (but for their credit they fixed it relatively fast.)

The jokes they made were terrible, about the store and screwdrivers, but probably were the sign of relief they felt (from constant pressure).

Altough humor is good, they really should have chosen self irony instead of advertising, in my opinion making a meme out of something like "auctioned not sold" would have been a much better recieved thing, by embracing the mistakes they made, they could have shown they do read criticism from the community and care about our opinion regardless, of the situation.

I think Madison's concern was valid. [The LTT community drove a kid to suicide for buying in an auction a Silver Play Button that Linus wanted.](https://www.reddit.com/r/LinusTechTips/comments/15sjv78/for_anyone_wondering_why_madison_stayed_silent/) Without LTT's community being as hotheaded as it is, I'd think your argument was fair, but that's not the world we live in.

As for Linus' credibility, yes he has bolstered other creators, but he has also been doubling down on mistakes he should have admitted. Moreover, he - or at least LMG - have also been actively censoring comments on their Youtube videos. I don't know how you weigh those things against each other.

And it can be quite a challenging thing being reminded of them every step of the way.

Removing comments regarding Madison imo might have been a sign of that, if that is the case - (since they are addressing the situation, and investigating, they aren't trying to swipe this under the rug atleast) - then removing those comments is a good thing, let the poor girl heal.

I would give the benefit of doubt to the new CEO, that he will do the right thing.
